page.title: 08OCCUPATIOPNS
page.content: In the last century most people who lived in our area also worked in the area, usually at the local mill. Today most of these mills have closed and there is very little industry. The only people who live and work in the area today are mostly shopkeepers and farmers. The people who live in this area are therefore commuters and most of them travel either to{Halifax}or to Bradford to work. The occupations of the children of Salterlee School include furniture upholsterer, car mechanic, woodwork machine maker, taxi driver, optician, jeweller, engineer, printer, lecturer, welder, salesman and photographer. The furthest any one travels to work is approximately 30 miles to his shop in Rotherham. Some mothers have part_time jobs in the many public houses and restaurents in this area.
